channel.title: Amazon on Tales of a technology enthusiast
channel.description: Recent content in Amazon on Tales of a technology enthusiast

item.title: ServerlessConf'18 in San Francisco - Day One
item.description: ServerlessConf Serverless The creation of an Alexa skill in 2016 was this aha moment I discovered the concept of serverless or more precisely Function as a Service a.

item.title: Goodbye 2017!
item.description: December 31st. There are few hours left before the New Year, kids are having a nap, house is quiet. Probably the right time to reflect upon 2017, another crazy year with so many things that happened.

item.title: AWSome!
item.description: Today I have passed the AWS Solutions Architect - Associate certification! And two weeks ago, I passed the AWS Developer - Associate certification. That’s the reason for going back to hibernation again, not easy to manage a demanding career with travels and work to do, whilst having quality time with family then find the time to work on it.

item.title: My first Alexa Skill
item.description: Back in November 2016, after few weeks enjoying Amazon Echo, I discovered ASK, Alexa Skill Kit i.e. an SDK made available by Amazon to develop your own skills.

item.title: I love you Alexa!
item.description: Last year, I discovered Amazon Echo, an amazing product launched by Amazon. It is a voice-controlled device that is connected and can perform various operations for you like telling the weather forecast, playing your favorite playlist on Spotify (or other services), book an Uber transfer or even a pizza!
